PSG EYE COUTINHO [skysports]

PSG will look to sign Liverpool’s Philippe Coutinho if they fail to land Monaco hotshot Kylian Mbappe, according to reports in France.

The Ligue 1 giants are keen to snap up Mbappe from their domestic rivals Monaco, but they will face stiff competition from Real Madrid to land the teenager.

Reports in France state that the French capital club have an alternative target, namely Liverpool’s Coutinho.

Liverpool have intimated on several occasions that the Brazil international is not for sale.

KLOPP: SALAH SPEED WILL BE KEY

Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp believes Mohamed Salah's speed will make the squad more effective.

The Reds paid Roma £34m for the Egyptian winger who was Klopp's first major signing of the summer.

"Even if people didn't know too much about him, they [must have] watched a few videos and they are impressive. He is a fantastic player, with speed," Klopp told the club's official website.

"We said after last season there are a few things we would try to involve in an already really good squad. One of the things is speed, being kind of a finisher, preparing chances, making goals and all that stuff. He brings all this in. He is a naturally fit boy - he can run as quick and as long as he wants. I'm really looking forward to [working with him]."

KLOPP: SALAH SPEED WILL BE KEY

Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp believes Mohamed Salah's speed will make the squad more effective.

The Reds paid Roma £34m for the Egyptian winger who was Klopp's first major signing of the summer.

"Even if people didn't know too much about him, they [must have] watched a few videos and they are impressive. He is a fantastic player, with speed," Klopp told the club's official website.

"We said after last season there are a few things we would try to involve in an already really good squad. One of the things is speed, being kind of a finisher, preparing chances, making goals and all that stuff. He brings all this in. He is a naturally fit boy - he can run as quick and as long as he wants. I'm really looking forward to [working with him]."

Middlesbrough will rival Newcastle United in an attempt to recruit Sheyi Ojo, the Liverpool youngster, on loan next season. (Paul Joyce)

Ojo is set to be granted a temporary move next season by manager Jürgen Klopp due to the competition for places at Anfield. (Paul Joyce)

Newcastle manager Rafa Benítez is keen to recruit Ojo from his former club as he prepares for life back in the Premier League. (Paul Joyce)

Klopp has a good relationship with both Rafa Benítez and Gary Monk, but will want Ojo to feature on a weekly basis. (Paul Joyce)
